classes.DB.php:
<?php
|!copyright!|

class |!file_name[uc]!| {
	// DB connection information
	public static $db_name = "";
	public static $db_user = "";
	public static $db_pw = "";

	// stores the only instance of the DB class
	private static $instance = null;

	// stores the PDO instance
	private $pdo_obj = null;

	private function __construct() {
		// create a connection to the DB and store it
		try {
			$this->pdo_obj = new PDO("mysql:host=localhost;dbname=".self::$db_name, self::$db_user, self::$db_pw);
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			// couldn't connect to DB
			return;
		}
	}

	// returns the DB connection
	// if one doesn't exist, then a connection will be created
	public static function getInstance() {
		// if a DB connection hasn't been created
		if (self::$instance == null) {
			// create a DB instance and store it
			$new_instance = new self;

			// if an instance was successfuly created, store it
			if ($new_instance->pdo_obj !== null) {
				self::$instance = $new_instance;
			}
		}

		return(self::$instance);
	}

	// begins a transaction
	// returns True if successful or False otherwise
	public function beginTransaction() {
		try {
			return((bool)$this->pdo_obj->beginTransaction());
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return(false);
		}
	}

	// commits a transaction
	// returns True if successful or False otherwise
	public function commit() {
		try {
			// check if there is an open transaction
			if (!(bool)$this->pdo_obj->inTransaction()) {
				// there isn't an open transition
				return(true);
			}

			return((bool)$this->pdo_obj->commit());
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return(false);
		}
	}

	// rollback a transaction
	// returns True if successful or False otherwise
	public function rollBack() {
		try {
			// check if there is an open transaction
			if (!(bool)$this->pdo_obj->inTransaction()) {
				// there isn't an open transition
				return(true);
			}

			return((bool)$this->pdo_obj->rollBack());
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return(false);
		}
	}

	// prepares and runs a SELECT query
	// returns all query's results, as an assoc array
	// NOTE: this is ONLY for SELECT queries
	// NOTE: only runs the query for 1 set of $input_params
	public function querySelect($query, array $input_params, array $param_types) {
		// make the query into a 1 line string
		$query = trim(preg_replace("/\r|\n|\t/", " ", $query));

		// sanity check
		if ($query === "" || preg_match("/^SELECT[ ]+/i", $query) !== 1 || (empty($input_params) && !empty($param_types)) || (!empty($input_params) && empty($param_types))) {
			return([]);
		}

		try {
			// prepare the query
			$pdo_statement = $this->pdo_obj->prepare($query);

			if ($pdo_statement === false) {
				// the query couldn't be prepared
				return([]);
			}

			// check if the #values in $input_params matches the #values in $param_types
			if (count($input_params) !== count($param_types)) {
				// they don't
				return([]);
			}

			// bind the params
			$params_bound = true;
			for ($i = 0; $i < count($input_params); $i++) {
				if (!$pdo_statement->bindValue($i + 1, $input_params[$i], $param_types[$i])) {
					// the bind param failled
					$params_bound = false;
					break;
				}
			}

			// execute the query
			if (!$params_bound || !$pdo_statement->execute()) {
				// the query couldn't be executed
				return([]);
			}

			// check if data was found
			if ($pdo_statement->rowCount() === 0) {
				// it wasn't
				return([]);
			}

			// fetch the results
			$pdo_results = $pdo_statement->fetchAll(PDO::FETCH_ASSOC);

			if ($pdo_results === false) {
				// failed to fetch results
				return([]);
			}

			// at this point everything should have gone OK
			return($pdo_results);
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return([]);
		}
	}

	// prepares and runs a query
	// returns the IDs of the inserted rows, in order the queries where executed
	// with NULL in the indexes of the ones that failled
	// NOTE: this is NOT for SELECT queries
	public function queryDetailed($query, array $input_params, array $param_types) {
		// make the query into a 1 line string
		$query = trim(preg_replace("/\r|\n|\t/", " ", $query));

		// sanity check
		if ($query === "" || preg_match("/^SELECT[ ]+/i", $query) !== 0 || empty($input_params) || empty($param_types)) {
			return([]);
		}

		try {
			// prepare the query
			$pdo_statement = $this->pdo_obj->prepare($query);

			if ($pdo_statement === false) {
				// the query couldn't be prepared
				return([]);
			}

			// stores the inserted IDs
			$inserted_ids = [];

			// loop through each $input_params element
			foreach ($input_params as $params_row) {
				// check if the #values in $input_params matches the #values in $param_types
				$params_bound = true;
				if (count($params_row) === count($param_types)) {
					// they do
					// bind the params
					for ($i = 0; $i < count($params_row); $i++) {
							if (!$pdo_statement->bindValue($i + 1, $params_row[$i], $param_types[$i])) {
							// the bind param failled
							$params_bound = false;
							break;
						}
					}
				}else{
					// they don't
					$params_bound = false;
				}

				// execute the query
				if ($params_bound && $pdo_statement->execute()) {
					// succcess, so store the inserted ID
					$inserted_ids[] = $this->pdo_obj->lastInsertId();
				}else{
					// the query couldn't be executed
					$inserted_ids[] = null;
				}
			}

			// return the inserted IDs
			return($inserted_ids);
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return([]);
		}
	}

	// prepares and runs a query
	// returns the number of affected rows
	// NOTE: this is NOT for SELECT queries
	public function querySimple($query, array $input_params, array $param_types) {
		// make the query into a 1 line string
		$query = trim(preg_replace("/\r|\n|\t/", " ", $query));

		// sanity check
		if ($query === "" || preg_match("/^SELECT[ ]+/i", $query) !== 0 || empty($input_params) || empty($param_types)) {
			return([]);
		}

		// used to control some querky behavior of the rowCount() function
		$max_row_count = null;

		// check if the query is "SELECT INTO ... ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE ..."
		if (preg_match("/^insert[ ]+into[ ]+.+[ ]+on[ ]+duplicate[ ]+key[ ]+update/i", $query) === 1) {
			// this type of query will return 2 for each affected row, when in fact it's just 1 affected row
			$max_row_count = 1;
		}

		try {
			// prepare the query
			$pdo_statement = $this->pdo_obj->prepare($query);

			if ($pdo_statement === false) {
				// the query couldn't be prepared
				return(0);
			}

			// stores the number of updated rows
			$num_affected_rows = 0;

			// loop through each $input_params element
			foreach ($input_params as $params_row) {
				// check if the #values in $input_params matches the #values in $param_types
				$params_bound = true;
				if (count($params_row) === count($param_types)) {
					// they do
					// bind the params
					for ($i = 0; $i < count($params_row); $i++) {
						if (!$pdo_statement->bindValue($i + 1, $params_row[$i], $param_types[$i])) {
							// the bind param failled
							$params_bound = false;
							break;
						}
					}
				}else{
					// they don't
					$params_bound = false;
				}

				// execute the query
				if ($params_bound && $pdo_statement->execute()) {
					// the query was executed
					// check if there is any max to the rowCount() return value
					if ($max_row_count === null) {
						// there isn't
						$num_affected_rows += $pdo_statement->rowCount();
					}else{
						// there is
						$num_affected_rows += min($pdo_statement->rowCount(), $max_row_count);
					}
				}
			}

			// return the number of updated rows
			return($num_affected_rows);
		}catch (PDOException $e) {
			return(0);
		}
	}
}

?>
classes.General.php:
<?php
|!copyright!|

class |!file_name[t]!| {
	// defines the PUBLIC_ROOT constant, containing the path to the project's public directory
	// i.e., the browser's root directory
	static function definePublicRoot($public_file_abs_path) {
		// make sure $public_file_abs_path ends with a backslash
		if (substr($public_file_abs_path, -1) !== "\\") {
			$public_file_abs_path .= "\\";
		}

		// work on building the path to the domain's public folder
		$public_file_abs_path = str_replace("/", "\\", $public_file_abs_path);

		// find the name of the domain's public folder
		$public_folder_valid_names = ["public_html", "www"];
		$public_folder_positions = [];
		foreach ($public_folder_valid_names as $value) {
			$pos = strpos($public_file_abs_path, "\\{$value}\\");

			if ($pos === false) {
				// this folder name doesn't exist in the path
				continue;
			}

			$public_folder_positions[$value] = $pos;
		}

		// make sure at least 1 of them was found
		if (empty(array_count_values($public_folder_positions))) {
			// couldn't find the domain's public folder name
			exit;
		}

		// find the folder that comes first in the path
		$public_folder_pos = min($public_folder_positions);
		$public_folder_name = array_search($public_folder_pos, $public_folder_positions);

		// find and store the path to the domain's public folder
		define("PUBLIC_ROOT", substr($public_file_abs_path, 0, $public_folder_pos + strlen($public_folder_name) + 1));
	}

	// returns the provided path in the form to be used by the client's machine browser
	static function getClientPath($abs_path) {
		// make sure the path is using backslashs as the folder divisor
		$abs_path = str_replace("/", "\\", $abs_path);

		return(str_replace("\\", "/", str_replace(PUBLIC_ROOT, "", $abs_path)));
	}

	// returns the provided path in the form to be used by the website's server
	static function getServerPath($abs_path) {
		// find which slash the server is using to separate path items
		if (strpos(dirname(__FILE__), "\\") === false) {
			// the server is using "/"
			$separator_search = "\\";
			$separator_replace = "/";
		}else{
			// the server is using "\"
			$separator_search = "/";
			$separator_replace = "\\";
		}

		return(str_replace($separator_search, $separator_replace, $abs_path));
	}

	// creates and returns a CSRF token
	static function generateToken() {
		$res = "";

		if (function_exists("mcrypt_create_iv")) {
			$res = bin2hex(mcrypt_create_iv(32, MCRYPT_DEV_URANDOM));
		} else {
			$res = bin2hex(openssl_random_pseudo_bytes(32));
		}

		return($res);
	}

	// validates a token
	// returns TRUE or FALSE
	static function validateToken($source_token, $token_to_validate) {
		// prepare the token to validate
		$token_to_validate = urldecode(html_entity_decode($token_to_validate));

		// run the comparison
		return(hash_equals($source_token, $token_to_validate));
	}
}

?>

templates.init.php:
<?php
|!copyright!|

// define a constant with the path to the project's root directory
define("PROJECT_ROOT", dirname(dirname(dirname(__DIR__))));

// load the General class
// try with the 2 slashes
if (file_exists(PROJECT_ROOT."\\release\\code\\classes\\General.php")) {
	require_once(PROJECT_ROOT."\\release\\code\\classes\\General.php");
}elseif (file_exists(PROJECT_ROOT."/release/code/classes/General.php")) {
	require_once(PROJECT_ROOT."/release/code/classes/General.php");
}else{
	// couldn't find the General class file
	echo("Couldn't load the General class!");
	exit;
}

// autoload classes
spl_autoload_register(function ($class_name) {
	// build the partial file path
	$path_partial = PROJECT_ROOT."\\release\\code\\";

	// folders to look for this class
	$folders = ["classes", "interfaces"];

	// loop through the folders
	foreach ($folders as $folder) {
		// build the full path
		$path_full = General::getServerPath($path_partial."{$folder}\\{$class_name}.php");

		// check if the file exists
		if (file_exists($path_full)) {
			// it does, so load it
			require_once($path_full);

			// all done
			break;
		}
	}
});

// define a constant with the path to the public directory
General::definePublicRoot(dirname(__FILE__));

require_once(General::getServerPath(PROJECT_ROOT."\\release\\code\\templates\\init.php"));

?>

Options +FollowSymlinks
RewriteEngine on

#
# no WWW rule
#

RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^|!no_www_domain!| [NC]
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ http://www.|!no_www_domain!|/$1 [L,R=302]

includes.autoloader.rb:
|!copyright!|

# load classes
dir = Dir.new("#{File.dirname(File.dirname(__FILE__))}\\classes")
dir.each do |file|
	if file.match(/^(.|..)$/)
		next
	end

	require "#{File.dirname(File.dirname(__FILE__))}\\classes\\#{file}"
end
dir.close

python.main.py:
|!copyright!|

import traceback
from classes import Application

# code that starts the entire application
try :
	# instantiate the application's main class
	app = Application()
except Exception as e :
	traceback.print_exc()
	print("\n")

classes.__init__.py:
|!copyright!|

import os

# list with the files to be imported when "from package import *" is called
__all__ = []

# grab the list of contents in this directory
dir_path = os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__))
dir_contents = os.listdir(dir_path)

# find all the python files
for item in dir_contents :
	# ignore this file
	if (item == "__init__.py") :
		continue

	# check if this item is a file
	if (not os.path.isfile(dir_path + "\\" + item)) :
		# it's not a file, so ignore
		continue

	# check if it's a python file
	if (not item.endswith(".py")) :
		# it isn't, so ignore
		continue

	# at this point this item is a python file, so add it to __all__
	# not including the ".py"
	__all__.append(item[:-3])
